intro: Apinagia platystigma, commonly known as the broad-stemmed apinagia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are arranged in umbels. Apinagia platystigma is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
